attributes.action: Remove the illegal injunction effecting road usage in Harlow.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/anglia/2016-05-21/injunction-taken-out-against-bikers-in-harlow/

Clear discrimination effecting your rights as a road user. Set by a council.
attributes.background:
Harlow raised an injunctionn against motorcycles which could land you in prison in contempt of court for riding A to B via Harlow or respectfully riding with friends.

This is clear discrimination set by a council effecting your rights to ride your motorcycle.

Link on it via Harlow injunction

rejection.details:
Courts in the UK are independent of Government and Parliament, so we can’t accept petitions asking for court judgments, including injunctions, to be overturned.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
